headers.subject: Re: How do I open por 8001
headers.received: (from mail@localhost) by int-mx1.corp.redhat.com (8.11.6/8.11.6) id g6FAllG11942 for enigma-list@listman.redhat.com; Mon, 15 Jul 2002 06:47:47 -0400
by burgers.bubbanfriends.org (Postfix, from userid 500) id 1A107401A40; Mon, 15 Jul 2002 06:47:45 -0400 (EDT)

body.para: Have you tried just adding "Listen 8001" to the conf file and restarting?
Do you have any firewalling going on?

quote.quotepara: My httpd is running but nobody is listening on port 8001
Following is the list of ports open( i.e. anybody listening)

Starting nmap V. 2.54BETA22 ( www.insecure.org/nmap/ ) Interesting ports on ns.igridcanada.com (142.179.66.247): (The 1535 ports scanned but not shown below are in state: closed) Port State Service 7/tcp open echo 22/tcp open ssh 25/tcp open smtp 37/tcp open time 53/tcp open domain 111/tcp open sunrpc 6000/tcp open X11

That bring s me back to the original question. How do I open up 8001( by making httpd listening to port 8001 of cause, but it
is not)

[root@ns ~]# ps -ax | grep httpd 1419 ? S 0:00 /usr/local/apache2/bin/httpd -d /usr/local/apache2 1420 ? S 0:00 /usr/local/apache2/bin/httpd -d /usr/local/apache2 1421 ? S 0:00 /usr/local/apache2/bin/httpd -d /usr/local/apache2 1422 ? S 0:00 /usr/local/apache2/bin/httpd -d /usr/local/apache2 1423 ? S 0:00 /usr/local/apache2/bin/httpd -d /usr/local/apache2 1424 ? S 0:00 /usr/local/apache2/bin/httpd -d /usr/local/apache2
